intro: Macronema walpolianum, commonly known as the white-flowered macronema, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a smooth texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
